name: Business Computing
long_desc: Students will learn how individuals and organizations use computing technologies to support and improve their businesses. At an individual level, students will build their skills with Microsoft Excel and other personal productivity tools. At an organizational level, the class looks at ways in which businesses of all sizes and types leverage computing technologies to run their businesses more efficiently, make better business decisions, and create new business opportunities. This course is reserved for firstyear Business students others may enroll by special permission from the UBA office only.

custom_fields.goals: Upon completing the course, a student will be able to do the following Analyze raw data for making business decisions Summarize raw data using different charts Perform sensitivity analyses. Explain how the Internet and other technologies are used by businesses to gain advantage. Anticipate and protect data and systems against cyberattacks.
custom_fields.key_topics: Individual Computing: Data analysis with formulas and functions; various types of charts; data tables and pivot tables; financial functions and text functions; what-if analyses and simple optimization. Organizational Computing: Information Technology (IT) strategy; IT infrastructure; systems development; data management; network technologies; cybersecurity; enterprise systems; digital products and markets; Artificial Intelligence tools in business.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Moderate level of computer proficiency and some interests in technology applications in business.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: The course grade will be based on: Problem sets that are designed to help individual students practice applying skills and concepts covered in class and aim to be similar to those questions on the exams; Short team assignments in which students will utilize the concepts covered in class to analyze real-life business problems; Three short mid-term and final exams; Participation in the class discussions.
custom_fields.relevance: This is the core business-computing course in the undergraduate business program. It teaches fundamental skills and concepts of data analysis used every day in business management. Students also learn the myriad linkages between business and information technology today. Concepts and skills learned in this course are stepping-stones to a majority of advance business courses.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Detailed lecture notes will be available during the semester. Lecture notes, homework, team assignments, practice exams and solutions available on Canvas; Textbooks; ample office hours.
